title: [K-12] Language Education Design for Building a Sustainable E-Learning Ecosystem: Strengthening Text, Vocabulary, and Communication Competencies

context.prior_knowledge: Foundational language learning experience (reading, writing, listening, speaking) and experience with online learning platforms, intermediate-level grammar and vocabulary proficiency
context.additional_context: Learner Role: Students/job seekers, Domain Expertise: Intermediate (grammar, vocabulary, communication, reading comprehension, writing), Technology Environment: Digital devices provided, Assessment Method: Project-based evaluation (writing, presentations, feedback reports, peer assessment).

learning_goals: Analyzing and explaining language learning elements (grammar, vocabulary, expression, reading comprehension, listening) within the three core components of e-learning ecosystems (pedagogy, content, system).
Planning and executing language learning projects (writing, reading, speaking, presentations) using a Learning Management System (LMS).

Learners design 2 sustainable digital learning resources (quizzes, videos, images, etc.) in 2–4 weeks via team projects (3–4 members), revise them based on ≥3 peer feedback rounds, and complete the process by sharing them on the school’s LMS.
difficulty: Moderate - Standard complexity with some constraints
